metadata.title: CVE-2019-16943 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind2.0.0 through 2.9.10. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally orfor a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and theservice has the p6spy (3.8.6) jar in the classpath, and an attacker canfind an RMI service endpoint to access, it is possible to make the serviceexecute a malicious payload. This issue exists because ofcom.p6spy.engine.spy.P6DataSource mishandling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.10.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
